publicationStmt.p: Digital edition hosted on http://rickandmorty.newtfire.org and GitHub: https://github.com/dorothealint/Rick-and-Morty

encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and getting rid of parentheses, brackes, and colons.

body.stage: Open Smith kitchen, int. Rick, Jerry, Beth are eating breakfast. Rick is building a robot at the table. Jerry is playing Jerry's Game
Rick starts welding. The bulk of the sparks fly towards Jerry, who turns away to dodge the bulk of them. Morty enters the room

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Hey Rick, I have to make a project for the science fair this weekend. You think you could help me out?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Whatever.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Well, um, traditionally science fairs are a father-son thing.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Well, scientifically, traditions are an idiot thing.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: typing on phone Morty, I think it will be fun for you to work on a science project with your dad.

body.stage: Beth sends Morty a text saying “Your father is insecure about his intelligence” which Morty reads

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: putting away phone, clears throat Yeah, dad, why don't we do it together?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Yes! You backed the right horse on this one, son! We'll get out the crayons, brew some coffee and knock this thing out in two or three days.

body.stage: Rick finishes the robot he was working on

sp.speaker: Butter robot
sp.p: What is my purpose?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Pass the butter.

body.stage: Butter robot passes butter

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Thank you.

body.stage: Summer enters

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Dad, I need a ride to work.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Maybe Rick can give you a ride. I'm helping Morty with science.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I'm busy.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Doing what?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Uh, anything else?

body.stage: Summer glares at Rick. Rick glares back

sp.speaker: Butter robot
sp.p: What is my purpose?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You pass butter.

sp.speaker: Butter robot
sp.p: Oh my god.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, welcome to the club, pal.

body.stage: into plays
Rick and Summer are in Rick's spaceship. Rick's driving, Summer's in the passenger seat

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Since when did you have a job?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Since last week. It's part time at this little vintage thrift store. My boss is this really smart eccentric old man that treats me nice and values me.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Wee-ow, can't wait to meet this fascinating character.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Please don't.

body.stage: Trans. Summer's workplace, Needful Things. It's empty except for Mr Needful, who's arranging his wares. Mr Goldenfold enters

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: Oh... when did this stop being jamba juice?

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: I've just recently opened for business, Mr, um, Goldenfold.

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: You know my name? That's disarming.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: I also know you long for female company.

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: You know, it has been lonely since the divorce. Some voids can't be filled with jamba juice.

sp.speaker: Needful: This aftershave makes a man quite irresistible to women. Free of charge
sp.p: one never pays here. Not with money.

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: Nothing to read into there! Thanks!

body.stage: Goldenfold takes the aftershave and leaves. Rick and Summer enter

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Sorry I'm late, Mr. Needful. This is my grandpa Rick, he was just leaving.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: inspecting objects Huh.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Tell me Rick, what do you desire?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Eh, I make my own stuff. So what are you, like, the devil?

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: What? Sorry?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I dunno, store comes out of nowhere, all the shit's old and creepy; are you the devil? A demon? Leprechaun?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Grandpa Rick!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hey, I'm not judging. I just like to shoot straight. I'm a man of science.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Ahah. Then perhaps you could make use of this. picks up microscope This microscope reveals things beyond comprehension. Hahahaha.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hahahahaha.

body.stage: The two continue laughing, each getting louder as they try to outdo each other

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Grandpa, go home and drink!

body.stage: Rick snatches the microscope from Mr. Needful and leaves
Trans. Int. Smith living room. Morty and Jerry are on the floor surrounded by art supplies

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Why don't we do a model of the solar system? That's what my dad did with me when I was your age.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh. Ok.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You know, Rick's in his lab making cyborgs and wormholes and all that weird stuff, but this is real science! A man and his boy, making planets! Hey, how ‘bout we use a ping-pong ball for Pluto, and then Jupiter-

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Uh, actually, I don't think Pluto's a planet.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: laughing Of course Pluto's a planet, son, I learned that in the third grade.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Well, yeah, but, you know, they changed it.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Morty, nobody changed the planets.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I just googled it. Uh, Pluto's not a planet. They changed it in 2006.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Yeah, I heard about that, Morty. And I disagree.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: You... disagree?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: That's right. It's possible to disagree in science, Morty. Pluto was a planet, some committee of fancy assholes disagree, I disagreed back. Gimmie a ping-pong ball.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Um, ok, I just have to-

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Go find Rick and go for my head about Pluto?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Gee-no! Geez! I just gotta go to the bathroom! Dayum!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Oh. coughs Okay good. This is gonna be fun!

body.stage: Trans. Int. garage. Rick's building a contraption, connected to a laptop and pointing towards the microscope he got from Mr. Needful. Morty walks past to get to the bathroom, but Rick interrupts him before he can get there

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hey, Morty, lemme ask you a question real quick. Does evil exist, and if so, can one detect and measure it?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Um...

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Rhetorical question Morty. The answer is yes, you just have to be a genius.

body.stage: The machine scans the microscope. A bar on the laptop marked “IQ” drops to close to 0

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Your sister's boss gave me a microscope that would have made me retarded.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ooh, oh boy Rick, I don't think you're allowed to say that word, you know?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Uh, Morty, I'm not disparaging the differently abled. I'm stating the fact that if I had used this microscope, it would have made me mentally retarded.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Okay, yeah, but I don't think it's about logic, Rick. I think the word's just become a symbolic issue for powerful groups that feel like they're doing the right thing.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Well that's retarded.

body.stage: Jerry lifts up the garage door

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: What are you guys talking about?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Apparently nothing.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You asked him if Pluto's a planet, didn't you?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: No!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: It's not.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Shut up, Rick.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Whoa.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I don't care what anyone says. If it can be a planet, it can be a planet again. Planet. Planet planet planet.

body.stage: Jerry leaves angrily

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Stay scientific, Jerry.

body.stage: Trans. Needful Things, ext. Mr Goldenfold enters the shop, followed by several women. Shot changes to interior. Mr Needful is at the counter, Summer is dusting. Several customers are shopping

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: This aftershave made women want me but it also made me impotent!

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: A price for everything, Mr. Goldenfold. A price... for everything! Muahahahaha!

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: crying Oh my god! How can I not see this coming? My lust! My greed! I deserve thi-

body.stage: Rick enters, kneels down and injects a serum into Goldenfold's neck

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: This serum should counteract the negative effects.

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: looking into own pants Holy cats! Ladies, let's get out of here.

body.stage: Goldenfold and co. leave

sp.speaker: Goldenfold
sp.p: outsideI haven't learned a thing!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: giving back microscope Here. You can have this back.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: You didn't use it?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Sure I did. To develop this. It detects and catalogues all your Twilight Zone Ray Bradbury Friday the 13th of series voodoo crap magic. I thought you might want it so you didn't accidentally sell anybody, say, scans a typewriter that generates best-selling murder mysteries, then makes the murders happen in real life? Oooh.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Be quiet!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Don't you want to make sure people know what they're getting? You're not intentionally selling scans beauty cream that makes ugly ladies pretty but also makes them blind?

body.stage: A customer looking at beauty cream leaves in a hurry

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: I find this all quite preposterous!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, I say, good sir! Oh, harrumph, oh, oh, bobba-doppa-doopa-bo-bo. scans animal fur scarf being tried on by customer That's beautiful, you know it's going to be wearing you in three hours?

body.stage: The customer rushes out. All other customers leave too

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Do I need to call the police?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Here, you can use my phone. Don't worry, it won't make you deaf because I'm not a hack.

body.stage: Mr. Needful slaps the phone out of Rick's hand. Rick slaps Mr. Needful's hat off his head

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Hey! No! Ugh!

body.stage: The two start slapping each other. Summer's protests punctuate the fight

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Think you're so great?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Stop it!

body.stage: Summer gets between the two

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: No! Stop! Hey, hey! Stop it right now!

body.stage: She pushes them away from each other

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Grandpa Rick, I like working here!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You work for the devil!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: So what?

sp.speaker: Rick and Needful
sp.p: "So what"?!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Yes, so what if he's the devil, Rick? At least the devil has a job. At least he's active in the community. What do you do? You eat our food, and make gadgets. Buh bye.

body.stage: Summer guides Rick out. On the way, Rick purposely knocks over a vase and slams the door. A ghost flies out and into the ceiling with a cackle

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Whoops.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I'm sorry Mr. Needful, I'll clean that up. I don't know what I can do about the ghost lady that came out of it, but...

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: It's fine. Summer, you know your grandfather's right. This store curses people. That's my business.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Well, yeah, fast food gives people diabetes and clothing stores have sweatshops. Is there a company hiring teenagers that isn't evil? This is my first job. You've been nice to me, Mr. Needful. You respect me.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Please, call me the devil.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I'd rather not, actually.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Yes, perhaps not during business hours.

body.stage: Trans. Smith living room. Morty's painting planets, Jerry's on the phone

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I told you, I want to file a declaration that Pluto is a planet! ... Well, then my son's going to fail his science class, and when that happens, I'm suing you first! hangs up I think I know what the A in NASA stands for.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Dad, what's your endgame?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Ain't no game, sucka.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Why don't we just make the solar system with eight planets? It's even easier!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Sure, sure, and why don't we just burn Galileo at the stake for saying the sun is round? Science isn't always easy, Morty!

body.stage: The house starts shaking. Jerry, Morty and the art supplies start flying

sp.speaker: Jerry and Morty
sp.p: Whoa, whoa! Whoa!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: What the hell?

body.stage: The two fly through the roof. A tractor beam from an alien spacecraft has abducted them
Trans. City in Pluto, ext
Trans. Plutonian building. The spaceship lands in front of the door and a ramp appears, leading Jerry and Morty downwards. King Flippynips approaches, being carried by four other plutonians

sp.speaker: Flippynips
sp.p: I'm King Flippynips, ruler of Pluto!

body.stage: Flippynips is let down

sp.speaker: Flippynips
sp.p: We discovered you quite by accident during routine surveillance of your world. You really gave it to those guys at NASA!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I was... you know... sometimes science is about conviction.

sp.speaker: Flippynips
sp.p: I'd like to introduce you to a few people that very much agree with you.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Oh. I...

body.stage: Flippynips leads Jerry and Morty to a balcony overlooking millions of Plutonians, all cheering. Flippynips speaks into a microphone

sp.speaker: Flippynips
sp.p: Plutonians! Jerry Smith is a scientist from Earth where he's creating a model of our solar system! Jerry, tell Pluto about your decision!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Pluto... is a planet.

sp.speaker: Flippynips
sp.p: Pluto's a fucking planet, bitch!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: to himself Oh man, this is definitely gonna go to his head.

body.stage: Trans. Needful things. Mr. Needful is at the counter, serving principal Vagina. Summer is working

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: If it's athletic prowess you desire, principal Vagina, I might-

sp.speaker: Vagina
sp.p: taking ball I'll take it!

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: But I haven't even-

sp.speaker: Vagina
sp.p: Thank you very very much, great store, great place, bye.

body.stage: Principal Vagina leaves

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Huh. Okay. I must say, Summer, I thought your grandfather's outburst would have disrupted business, but this is the best weekend I've had since Salem!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Nice! Wholesome delight for lunch?

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Is that the vegan place?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Yeah, I love their soup.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: I'm kind of souped out.

body.stage: A customer enters the store

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Mrs. Tate, is it? What do you desire?

body.stage: She takes an armful of goods and makes to leave

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Whoa, whoa, slow down, honey!

sp.speaker: Tate
sp.p: Oh, is there a limit? Everything's free, right?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Let's just say... you don't pay with money. laughing

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: laughing That was perfect.

sp.speaker: Tate
sp.p: You pay with the curses, right?

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Um, I... well-

body.stage: She opens the door to leave

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: But Mrs. Tate! Why do you want cursed items?

sp.speaker: Tate
sp.p: Well, I'm going to get the curses removed. At curse purge plus. You know, the guy on TV?

body.stage: She points at the TV and leaves. Rick's on. Mr. Needful turns up the volume

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: What?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Have you acquired creepy, specific old stuff from an antique or thrift store that grants you powers but fucks with you in unforeseeable ways? Bring it to Curse Purge Plus! I use science to uncurse the items for cash, and you get to keep the powers! This guy got mysterious sneakers to make him run faster! But guess what? He would have had to run until he died, making them worthless. I removed the curse, making them worth, like, I dunno, eight million dollars? See ya at the olympics. This eerily intelligent doll was threatening to murder its family. Now it does their taxes.

sp.speaker: Baby
sp.p: Everything's deductible.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Don't pay for cool stuff with your soul. Pay for it with money. You know, like how every other store in the world works? We're located at First and Main in old town. Come on, come on down.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: First... and...

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Wubba... lubba... dub dub!

body.stage: Mr Needful looks outside and pulls up the blind. Curse Purge Plus is opposite Needful Things. Rick's flipping them the bird

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Wubba lubba dub dub!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: That's right across the street from Needful Things, where you can get evil items for free!

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Diabolical son of a mother-

body.stage: The door opens and customers rush in, looting the place
Trans. Pluto. Jerry's being recorded for a talk show. Morty's watching

sp.speaker: Hostess
sp.p: We're back on Good Morning Pluto, and a very good morning it is for our guest, Earth scientist Jerry Smith, who is making headlines with his bold announcement that is, what Jerry?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Pluto is a planet.

sp.speaker: Host
sp.p: laughing How about that?

sp.speaker: Hostess
sp.p: Wow. I love it!

body.stage: Scroopy Noopers enters from behind Morty

sp.speaker: Scroopy Noopers
sp.p: Morty Smith. I'm Scroopy Noopers. I'm a scientist. Can I show you something?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Uh... I'd better not.

sp.speaker: Scroopy Noopers
sp.p: pulling out a gun Right now.

body.stage: Trans. Plutonian mines. Scroopy Noopers takes Morty for a tour. Machines pump glowing blue rocks to the surface

sp.speaker: Scroopy Noopers
sp.p: The centre of Pluto, Mr. Smith, is made up of a substance called plutonium. Mines like these suck Plutonium up to the cities, where corporations use it to power everything, from diamond cars to golden showers. And the more we remove, the more Pluto shrinks.

body.stage: The planet shakes

sp.speaker: Scroopy Noopers
sp.p: There it goes again. Just shrank a little. But a few years ago, your scientists had noticed Pluto had gotten so small they couldn't even call it a planet any more. Should have been our wake up call. But the rich plutonians won't wake up. And they love your dad telling everyone Pluto's a planet, because that means they can keep mining until Pluto goes from planet to asteroid to meteor, and finally, poof. At the last word, he blows a handful of blue dust into the air

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Um... A party?

sp.speaker: Scroopy Noopers
sp.p: Is everyone in your family an idiot?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: For sure me and my dad are.

sp.speaker: Scroopy Noopers
sp.p: sigh Well, all you have to do is get him to admit that, and you could save four billion lives.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Uh, yeah, you know, the thing is... my dad's really insecure.

body.stage: Trans. Needful things. The store is empty except for Summer, who's cleaning up, and Mr. Needful, who's in the back out of view. The shelves are all empty. Summer spots a monkey paw on the floor and picks it up

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Hm, funny. Mr Needful, out of everything in the store you'll never guess what we couldn't get rid of!

body.stage: She opens the door to the back room and sees that Mr Needful has hung himself

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Ah! Oh my god!

body.stage: She tries to pull him down. When that fails she pushes at a desk in the corner to try and move it under him, also unsuccessfully

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh my god. using monkey paw I wish this desk was lighter!

body.stage: One of the paw's three fingers goes down. She easily pushes the desk under Mr Needful and struggles to untie the noose

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: using monkey paw I wish this knot was looser!

body.stage: The second finger goes down. The noose comes undone easily and she rushes over and tries to perform CPR, though she doesn't know how

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Come on! I don't... Augh! Wait! What am I doing? using monkey paw I wish I knew CPR!

body.stage: The third finger goes down. Summer performs CPR

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: One, two, three! One, two, three!

body.stage: Mr Needful splutters and regains consciousness

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: coughing Ugh, Jesus. What a waste of a monkey paw.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Mr. Needful! How could you even think of doing something so horrible?

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: I'm the devil. What should I do when I fail, give myself an ice-cream?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: You haven't failed.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: People like Rick are making me obsolete. I mean seriously, I may be the devil but your grandpa is the devil! I just want to go back to hell where everybody thinks I'm smart and funny.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: No! It's not fair. Everyone in this town got something they wanted from you, even Rick! I was your only friend, and I get nothing?

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Okay, I'll give you one thing. Name it.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I wanna help you.

sp.speaker: Needful
sp.p: Clever twist.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I learned from the best, you old fart. Now let's go get you hydrated.

body.stage: Trans. Curse Purge Plus, int. Customers are bringing up their items to be scanned and treated

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Looks like we've got... haunted boxing gloves that will make you the heavyweight champion, in 1936 and then you'll be trapped there winning the same fight for eternity. I can take out the eternity, and the padding, and then you'll have some time travelling mittens.

body.stage: Summer enters with a box of items

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, look, it's Rosemary's baby! How's business?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Here's the last of our inventory. We're going to file chapter 11 and do some restructuring.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Sounds like code for ‘You win, Rick!'

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: That was important to you, wasn't it?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Nope, it was important to your dumb devil friend. To me this was all just a bit like when Bugs Bunny fucks with the opera singer for twenty minutes.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: He tried to kill himself.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Seriously? Holy crap. Holy crap.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: But you know what, grandpa Rick? He's strong. And he's never going to give up.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Uh huh, yeah, I don't care.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh, I know. Everyone knows you don't care.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: So?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: So... have fun not caring.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I always do.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Good.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, it is good. It's the best.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I'm sure it is. Bye.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Later!

body.stage: Summer leaves

sp.speaker: Customer
sp.p: I'm here to pick up my undead cat and child.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, uh, gimmie a sec.

sp.speaker: Employee
sp.p: These are the forms for the employee health plan.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Alright, yeah, uh, put ‘em on my... eh.

body.stage: He pours gasoline on the floor and sets it on fire

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I just got bored. Everybody out.

body.stage: Trans. Pluto. Morty and Jerry are in suits in the passenger seats of an alien car. Jerry is fussing over his appearance in a small mirror

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Alright, just one more rally, then I promise, we'll get back to your science project.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Dad, Pluto isn't a planet! It's shrinking because of corporations!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Yeah, that's what that anti-planet nutjob Scroopy Noopers was screaming about outside the Ministry of Moneys fundraiser. Are you telling me four billion plutonians are wrong?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: You told me science wasn't easy!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I said science isn't always easy, obviously that means sometimes it is easy. Let's not debase ourselves with word games, son.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Dad, their whole planet is dying!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Hah! You called it a planet! Checkmate.

body.stage: The car parks and Jerry gets out, to fanfare

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: What's up, Pluto?

body.stage: Trans. Plutonian ball. Music is playing. Jerry is being treated like a celebrity. He's approached by a plutonian woman and man

sp.speaker: Plutonian woman
sp.p: Mr. Smith, please! Tell my friend here what you just told me, go on.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: My Very Eager Mother Just Served Us Nine Pickles, and the pickles is Pluto.

body.stage: The plutonian man does a spit take

sp.speaker: Plutonian man
sp.p: My god! The man's a genius!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Um, excuse me? taps champagne glass with spoon

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Morty, what?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Dad, what did you think about the recent report published by the Pluto Science Reader, linking plutoquakes, sinkholes and surface shrinkage to deep core plutonium drilling?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: ...Well son, what did you think when you were five, and you pooped your pants, and you threw your poopy undies out your bedroom window because you thought it was like throwing something in the garbage?

sp.speaker: Jerry
